member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.Chocolatey.ChocolateyAliases.ChocolateyPack(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Common.Tools.Chocolatey.Pack.ChocolateyPackSettings)
member.summary: Creates a Chocolatey package using the specified Nuspec file.

example.code:
var chocolateyPackSettings = new ChocolateyPackSettings { Id = "TestChocolatey", Title = "The tile of the package", Version = "0.0.0.1", Authors = new[] {"John Doe"}, Owners = new[] {"Contoso"}, Summary = "Excellent summary of what the package does", Description = "The description of the package", ProjectUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), PackageSourceUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), ProjectSourceUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), DocsUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), MailingListUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), BugTrackerUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), Tags = new [] {"Cake", "Script", "Build"}, Copyright = "Some company 2015", LicenseUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/blob/master/LICENSE.md"), RequireLicenseAcceptance= false, IconUrl = new Uri("http://cdn.rawgit.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/master/icons/testchocolatey.png"), ReleaseNotes = new [] {"Bug fixes", "Issue fixes", "Typos"}, Files = new [] { new ChocolateyNuSpecContent {Source = "bin/TestChocolatey.dll", Target = "bin"}, }, Debug = false, Verbose = false, Force = false, Noop = false, LimitOutput = false, ExecutionTimeout = 13, CacheLocation = @"C:\temp", AllowUnofficial = false };
ChocolateyPack("./nuspec/TestChocolatey.nuspec", chocolateyPackSettings);

member.summary: Creates a Chocolatey package using the specified settings.

example.code:
var chocolateyPackSettings = new ChocolateyPackSettings { Id = "TestChocolatey", Title = "The tile of the package", Version = "0.0.0.1", Authors = new[] {"John Doe"}, Owners = new[] {"Contoso"}, Summary = "Excellent summary of what the package does", Description = "The description of the package", ProjectUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), PackageSourceUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), ProjectSourceUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), DocsUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), MailingListUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), BugTrackerUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), Tags = new [] {"Cake", "Script", "Build"}, Copyright = "Some company 2015", LicenseUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/blob/master/LICENSE.md"), RequireLicenseAcceptance= false, IconUrl = new Uri("http://cdn.rawgit.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/master/icons/testchocolatey.png"), ReleaseNotes = new [] {"Bug fixes", "Issue fixes", "Typos"}, Files = new [] { new ChocolateyNuSpecContent {Source = "bin/TestChocolatey.dll", Target = "bin"}, }, Debug = false, Verbose = false, Force = false, Noop = false, LimitOutput = false, ExecutionTimeout = 13, CacheLocation = @"C:\temp", AllowUnofficial = false };
ChocolateyPack(chocolateyPackSettings);

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.NuGetAliases.NuGetPack(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Pack.NuGetPackSettings)
member.summary: Creates a NuGet package using the specified Nuspec file.

example.code:
var nuGetPackSettings = new NuGetPackSettings { Id = "TestNuget", Version = "0.0.0.1", Title = "The tile of the package", Authors = new[] {"John Doe"}, Owners = new[] {"Contoso"}, Description = "The description of the package", Summary = "Excellent summary of what the package does", ProjectUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/"), IconUrl = new Uri("http://cdn.rawgit.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/master/icons/testnuget.png"), LicenseUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/blob/master/LICENSE.md"), Copyright = "Some company 2015", ReleaseNotes = new [] {"Bug fixes", "Issue fixes", "Typos"}, Tags = new [] {"Cake", "Script", "Build"}, RequireLicenseAcceptance= false, Symbols = false, NoPackageAnalysis = true, Files = new [] { new NuSpecContent {Source = "bin/TestNuget.dll", Target = "bin"}, }, BasePath = "./src/TestNuget/bin/release", OutputDirectory = "./nuget" };
NuGetPack("./nuspec/TestNuget.nuspec", nuGetPackSettings);

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.NuGetAliases.NuGetPack(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Pack.NuGetPackSettings)
member.summary: Creates a NuGet package using the specified settings.

example.code:
var nuGetPackSettings = new NuGetPackSettings { Id = "TestNuget", Version = "0.0.0.1", Title = "The tile of the package", Authors = new[] {"John Doe"}, Owners = new[] {"Contoso"}, Description = "The description of the package", Summary = "Excellent summary of what the package does", ProjectUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/"), IconUrl = new Uri("http://cdn.rawgit.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/master/icons/testnuget.png"), LicenseUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/blob/master/LICENSE.md"), Copyright = "Some company 2015", ReleaseNotes = new [] {"Bug fixes", "Issue fixes", "Typos"}, Tags = new [] {"Cake", "Script", "Build"}, RequireLicenseAcceptance= false, Symbols = false, NoPackageAnalysis = true, Files = new [] { new NuSpecContent {Source = "bin/TestNuget.dll", Target = "bin"}, }, BasePath = "./src/TestNuget/bin/release", OutputDirectory = "./nuget" };
NuGetPack(nuGetPackSettings);

member.summary: The /domain option controls of the creation of AppDomains for running tests.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3AppDomainUsage.Default
member.summary: Create a separate AppDomain for each assembly if more than one is listed on the command line, otherwise creates a single AppDomain.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3AppDomainUsage.None
member.summary: No AppDomain is created - the tests are run in the primary domain. This normally requires copying the NUnit assemblies into the same directory as your tests.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3AppDomainUsage.Single
member.summary: A single test AppDomain is created for all test assemblies This is how NUnit worked prior to version 2.4.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3AppDomainUsage.Multiple
member.summary: An AppDomain is created for each assembly specified on the command line.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Labels.On
member.summary: Outputs labels for tests that are run.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Labels.All
member.summary: Outputs labels for all tests.

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3ProcessOption
member.summary: Represents the various ways NUnit loads tests in processes.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3ProcessOption.Multiple
member.summary: A separate process is created for each test assembly. This is the default.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3ProcessOption.Separate
member.summary: One separate process is created to run all of the test assemblies.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3ProcessOption.InProcess
member.summary: All the tests are run in the nunit-console process.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.SchemaName
member.summary: Gets or sets the schema name to use instead of [RoundhousE].
member.value: The schema where RH stores it's tables.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.Environment
member.summary: Gets or sets the environment for RH to be scoped.
member.value: This allows RH to be environment aware and only run scripts that are in a particular environment based on the namingof the script. LOCAL.something**.ENV.**sql would only be run in the LOCAL environment.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.Restore
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether perform a restore.
member.value: This instructs RH to do a restore (with the parameter) of a database before running migration scripts.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.RestoreFilePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the restore file path.
member.value: File path of back when Restore is set to true

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.CreateDatabaseCustomScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom database creation script.
member.value: This instructs RH to use this script for creating a database instead of the default based on the SQLType.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.OutputPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the output path.
member.value: Path to where migration artifacts are stored.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.WarnOnOneTimeScriptChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to warn when previously run scripts have changed.
member.value: Instructs RH to execute changed one time scripts (DDL/DML in 'Up'/) that have previously been run against the database instead of failing. A warning is logged for each one time scripts that is rerun.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.Silent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to keep RH silent.
member.value: Tells RH not to ask for any input when it runs.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.DatabaseType
member.summary: Gets or sets database type.
member.value: Database Type (fully qualified class name implementing [roundhouse.sql.Database, roundhouse])

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.Drop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to drop the DB.
member.value: This instructs RH to remove a database and not run migration scripts.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.WithTransaction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use transactions.
member.value: This instructs RH to run inside of a transaction.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.RecoveryMode
member.summary: Gets or sets SQL Server recovery mode.
member.value: This sets the recovery model for SQL Server during migration. (NoChange, Simple, Full)

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.DryRun
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to perform a dry run.
member.value: This instructs RH to log what would have run, but not to actually run anything against the database. Use this option if you are trying to figure out what RH is going to do.

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlPokeAliases.XmlPoke(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the value of, or remove, target nodes.
member.param: The xpath of the nodes to set.
The value to set too. Leave blank to remove the selected nodes.

example.para: Change the server setting in the configuration from testhost.somecompany.com to productionhost.somecompany.com.
Modify the noNamespaceSchemaLocation in an XML file.
Remove an app setting from a config file.
example.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="server" value="testhost.somecompany.com" /> <add key="testing" value="true" /> </appSettings> </configuration>

example.para: Credit to NAnt for the original example. http://nant.sourceforge.net/release/latest/help/tasks/xmlpoke.html
